contentrichtext.text: [[File:Yellowknife River downstream.JPG|thumb|250px|Yellowknife River looking downstream near where it flows under the [[Ingraham Trail]]]] The '''Yellowknife River''' is a river in the [[Northwest Territories]], [[Canada]]. It flows south and empties into [[Yellowknife Bay]], part of [[Great Slave Lake]], at the city of [[Yellowknife]]. The lake is drained by the [[Mackenzie River]] into the [[Arctic Ocean]] as part of the largest [[drainage basin]] in Canada. The name of the river derives from the [[Yellowknife (tribe)|Yellowknife tribe]], a [[First Nations]] people that formerly lived in the area. The city of Yellowknife draws its water supply from the river.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.iti.gov.nt.ca/tourismparks/parks/parks/yellowknife_river_day_use_area.shtml|title=Yellowknife River Day Use Area|author=Government of the Northwest Territories|accessdate=2009-09-01}}</ref> ==See also== *[[List of rivers of the Northwest Territories]] ==References== {{Commons category}} {{reflist}} {{coord|name=Yellowknife River mouth|62.51953|-114.32087|display=title|type:waterbody_region:CA}} {{Northwest Territories hydrography}} [[Category:Rivers of the Northwest Territories]] {{NorthwestTerritories-geo-stub}}
